adjectives.description: emulate (comparative more emulate, superlative most emulate)

verbs.description: emulate (third-person singular simple present emulates, present participle emulating, simple past and past participle emulated)

entries.meaning: (now rare) To attempt to equal or be the same as.
To copy or imitate, especially a person.
examples: People are endlessly fascinating, even if you'd never want to emulate them.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To feel a rivalry with; to be jealous of, to envy.
examples: But the councell then present emulating my successe, would not thinke it fit to spare me fortie men to be hazzarded in those unknowne regions [...].

entries.meaning: (computing) of a program or device: to imitate another program or device
